scenes.background: The team has successfully completed an important project, and everyone is excited to organize a celebration. However, there are differing opinions on how to celebrate. Colleague Sam suggests going to a bar for a lively party, Emma prefers a formal dinner, and Ryan proposes an outdoor team-building activity. Alex suggests a bit of everything: starting with an outdoor activity, then having dinner, and ending the night at a bar. Monica and Bob have been discussing this, and you notice some tension as they approach you. Monica crosses her arms and says, 'Alex, do you really think we can fit all that in one evening? And Bob here thinks we should just stick to one thing.' Bob nods in agreement, looking a bit annoyed. Alex insists that experiencing all three would be a memorable celebration and suggests giving it a try. Monica sighs and says, 'Alright, but what if we end up rushing through everything and no one enjoys any of it?' Bob adds, 'Yeah, and some of us might not even want to go to a bar.' Alex then suggests if it's too complicated, they might as well just go with a simple dinner to avoid issues. Monica looks a bit disappointed and says, 'A simple dinner might be too boring after such a big accomplishment.' Bob, on the other hand, seems relieved and nods, 'Yeah, but it's the safest option.' Alex then proposes skipping the celebration altogether and just getting back to work.
scenes.description: Monica rolls her eyes and says, 'Skipping the celebration is not an option. We worked hard and deserve to enjoy this.' Bob adds, 'Yeah, but we need to find something that works for everyone.'

options.text: Well, maybe we can brainstorm some new ideas that incorporate a bit of what everyone wants.
options.analysis: This option shows a high level of emotional detection and empathy by considering the concerns of both Monica and Bob. It demonstrates good social skills and motivation to reach a compromise.

options.text: I understand, but if we can't agree, we might just have to go with the safest option.
options.analysis: This choice shows good self-regulation and social skills but slightly lower empathy as it prioritizes sticking to the safest option and avoiding any potential complications.

options.text: If it's this hard to decide, maybe we should just each do our own thing and celebrate separately.
options.analysis: This option reflects empathy and emotional detection by considering the difficulties in reaching a consensus, but shows lower motivation as it proposes a divided solution.
